column4: hi all.. I have ubunut server 9.04 on a VPS, I installed the desktop pack on it, but now when I type STARTX I get this error log: http://paste.ubuntu.com/376753/
can i have a remote desktop on a ubuntu server VPS??? is it possible?
I think the VPS machine has no screen to let run X on it. Try vncserver instead
i tried it
(I do that a lot here with Ubuntu machines running oin Xen)

To verify that the server is listening on the vnc port (5901, 5902, 5903 in your case) you can check `netstat -tlpen  |grep 5901` on the server. Maybe there'S a firewall blocking that packets. I would recommend using `vncviewer 127.0.0.1:1 -via <server>`.
Oh, you're connecting from a windows client. I don't know whether it supports the "-via" option but you can establish an ssh tunnel manually using putty for example
what does that output mean?

It means the server is listening on that port but maybe some packet filter _between_ you and the server is blocking it. I'd strongly recommend using an encrypted ssh tunnel in the case you have not full control over the network.
how do i do that?
You already use putty to connect to the VPS?
Open connection settings, look for ssh tunnel, define a local listening port (like 12345 or 5901 too) and a remote endpoint (127.0.0.1:5901). Then open vncviewer and connect to ":1".
local listening port=source port, and remote endpoint=destination ?
choose a local listening port and connect to that later. Remote endpoint (the server) should be 127.0.0.1 on port 5901.
- i chose 5901 as local listening, and remote point as u said
When your local listening port is 5901 connect to 127.0.0.1:1 or just :1 on newer vncviewers
In case you can't occupy the 590* ports locally choose something like 12345 and connect to 127.0.0.1::12345 (double colon)
So there's at least a connection ;-)
source port and local port 12345?
12345 is just an example. Port 5901 seems to be available on your local machine so keep using it
same error msg. closed unexpectedly
Tried another vncviewer?
